books.title: Eloquent JavaScript, Second Edition
books.subtitle: A Modern Introduction to Programming
books.author: Marijn Haverbeke
books.description: JavaScript lies at the heart of almost every modern web application, from social apps to the newest browser-based games. Though simple for beginners to pick up and play with, JavaScript is a flexible, complex language that you can use to build full-scale applications.

books.title: Learning JavaScript Design Patterns
books.subtitle: A JavaScript and jQuery Developer's Guide
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.description: With Learning JavaScript Design Patterns, you'll learn how to write beautiful, structured, and maintainable JavaScript by applying classical and modern design patterns to the language. If you want to keep your code efficient, more manageable, and up-to-date with the latest best practices, this book is for you.

books.title: Speaking JavaScript
books.subtitle: An In-Depth Guide for Programmers
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.description: Like it or not, JavaScript is everywhere these days-from browser to server to mobile-and now you, too, need to learn the language or dive deeper than you have. This concise book guides you into and through JavaScript, written by a veteran programmer who once found himself in the same position.

books.title: Programming JavaScript Applications
books.subtitle: Robust Web Architecture with Node, HTML5, and Modern JS Libraries
books.author: Eric Elliott
books.description: Take advantage of JavaScript's power to build robust web-scale or enterprise applications that are easy to extend and maintain. By applying the design patterns outlined in this practical book, experienced JavaScript developers will learn how to write flexible and resilient code that's easier-yes, easier-to work with as your code base grows.

books.title: Understanding ECMAScript 6
books.subtitle: The Definitive Guide for JavaScript Developers
books.author: Nicholas C. Zakas
books.description: ECMAScript 6 represents the biggest update to the core of JavaScript in the history of the language. In Understanding ECMAScript 6, expert developer Nicholas C. Zakas provides a complete guide to the object types, syntax, and other exciting changes that ECMAScript 6 brings to JavaScript.

books.title: You Don't Know JS
books.subtitle: ES6 & Beyond
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.description: No matter how much experience you have with JavaScript, odds are you don’t fully understand the language. As part of the "You Don’t Know JS" series, this compact guide focuses on new features available in ECMAScript 6 (ES6), the latest version of the standard upon which JavaScript is built.

books.title: Git Pocket Guide
books.subtitle: A Working Introduction
books.author: Richard E. Silverman
books.description: This pocket guide is the perfect on-the-job companion to Git, the distributed version control system. It provides a compact, readable introduction to Git for new users, as well as a reference to common commands and procedures for those of you with Git experience.

books.title: Designing Evolvable Web APIs with ASP.NET
books.subtitle: Harnessing the Power of the Web
books.author: Glenn Block, et al.
books.description: Design and build Web APIs for a broad range of clients—including browsers and mobile devices—that can adapt to change over time. This practical, hands-on guide takes you through the theory and tools you need to build evolvable HTTP services with Microsoft’s ASP.NET Web API framework. In the process, you’ll learn how design and implement a real-world Web API.

magazines.title: National Geographic
magazines.description: Exploring the wonders of the natural world, science, and history through stunning photography and in-depth articles.

magazines.title: Popular Science
magazines.description: Showcasing groundbreaking science and technology with accessible explanations and future-focused features.

magazines.title: Time
magazines.description: Covers world news, politics, and culture through compelling reporting and engaging commentary.

magazines.title: PC Magazine
magazines.description: Providing reviews, tips, and insights into the latest technology trends and products.

magazines.title: The New York Times Magazine
magazines.description: In-depth journalism on culture, politics, and the arts.

magazines.title: The Guardian Weekly
magazines.description: A curated selection of stories from The Guardian, covering world news and features.

magazines.title: Scientific American
magazines.description: Covers the latest developments in science and technology for curious readers.

magazines.title: Wired
magazines.description: Explores how technology impacts culture, the economy, and our personal lives.

magazines.title: Smithsonian
magazines.description: Stories about history, science, and culture from the Smithsonian Institution.

magazines.title: Life
magazines.description: Celebrating photography and storytelling with an emphasis on human interest stories.

movies.title: The Shawshank Redemption
movies.description: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

movies.title: Inception
movies.description: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.

movies.title: The Godfather
movies.description: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

movies.title: The Dark Knight
movies.description: When the menace known as the Joker emerges, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

movies.title: Forrest Gump
movies.description: The story of a man with a low IQ who accomplishes great things in his life despite his disability.

movies.title: The Matrix
movies.description: A computer hacker learns the shocking truth about his reality and his role in the war against its controllers.

movies.title: Back to the Future
movies.description: A teenager travels back in time and must make sure his high-school-age parents unite to save his own existence.

movies.title: The Lion King
movies.description: A young lion prince flees his kingdom after the murder of his father and learns about the true meaning of responsibility.

movies.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
movies.description: A meek Hobbit and his friends set out on a journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

movies.title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
movies.description: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station.
